    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.8e91ee8b: data['Year']=pd.to_datetime(data['Year'],infer_datetime_format=True)# change the datatype of year column from int to date time format
source.8eabec94:
fig,ax=plt.subplots(ncols=2,figsize=(20,7))
sns.lineplot(data=data,x='Year',y='Avg rainfall(in mm)',ax=ax[0])
sns.lineplot(data=data,x='Year',y='Avg temp(in centigrade)',ax=ax[1],color='red')
source.7c1f4ae6: we can see that in tempreture range 7.5 -10 centigrade the avg rainfall is maximum(600-1100mm)
source.79a4c378: there is almost no correlation between temp and rainfall
source.924659ca: we can see that variation of avg temp is not very large, maximum avg tempreture is less than room tempreture.So it is cold climate area
source.e55a2b3b: maximum count of rainfall is less than 200
source.e78cf1d7: avg temp is maximum in july and august ,and in summer as well
